definition.name: NXdispersion_function

symbol.name: n_repetitions
symbol.doc: The number of repetitions for the repeated parameters

definition.doc: This describes a dispersion function for a material or layer

field.name: model_name
field.doc: The name of this dispersion model.

field.name: formula
field.doc: This should be a python parsable function. Here we should provide which keywords are available and a BNF of valid grammar.

field.name: convention
field.doc: The sign convention being used (n + or - ik)

field.name: energy_identifier
field.doc: The identifier used to represent energy in the formula. It is recommended to use `E`.

field.name: energy_min
field.doc: The minimum energy value at which this formula is valid.

field.name: energy_max
field.doc: The maximum energy value at which this formula is valid.

field.name: energy_unit
field.doc: The energy unit used in the formula. The field value is a scaling factor for the units attribute. It is recommeded to set the field value to 1 and carry all the unit scaling information in the units attribute.

field.name: wavelength_identifier
field.doc: The identifier useed to represent wavelength in the formula. It is recommended to use `lambda`.

field.name: wavelength_unit
field.doc: The wavelength unit used in the formula. The field value is a scaling factor for the units attribute. It is recommeded to set the field value to 1 and carry all the unit scaling information in the units attribute.

field.name: wavelength_min
field.doc: The minimum wavelength value at which this formula is valid.

field.name: wavelength_max
field.doc: The maximum wavelength value at which this formula is valid.

field.name: representation
field.doc: Which representation does the formula evaluate to. This may either be n for refractive index or eps for dielectric function. The appropriate token is then to be used inside the formula.
